title: Stunning and works great
body:
I meant to buy the regular sized version of this (34 ounces), but I guess I ordered the small one by accident. So, I was disappointed when the tiny one arrived. But, I guess that's on me. Why do French Presses say "3 Cups" when they only hold 12 ounces? There are 8 ounces in a cup. So, I would expect 24 ounces. Who decided that french press cups were half the size of an actual measuring cup?

Anyway. This says it makes 1.5 cups of coffee. I would agree if you're drinking really small cups of coffee. I have a "normal" size coffee mug, and if I fill this press to the top of the copper line, it nearly fills my mug. So, I'm clearly not getting another half cup out of it. It holds 12 ounces, but you have to leave room for the coffee grounds, too.

With that said, it is a beautiful copper mug. If you rinse it out with hot water before using it, I suspect that the copper helps to spread the heat more evenly throughout the beaker. I was also given fine ground beans when I specifically asked for course ground, but I'm happily not getting much sediment, and it was still easy to press the plunger down.

This is so beautiful, that it's OK to leave out on the counter top or hanging from a hook, in view. (saves on storage space) If you have copper pots and pans, this should match nicely.

If I had the opportunity to order again, I'd order their "normal" sized version. You can always just put less in a larger container. You can't put more in a smaller container. I'd only get this one again if I was using it for hiking or camping or something. But this will work at my desk at work.
